intro: Glyphochloa divergens, commonly known as the narrowleaf grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. Glyphochloa divergens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including coastal areas and open woodlands.
